title: Where in the world?
text:
CNN Leadership
Where in the world? Updated 1442 GMT (2142 HKT) September 7, 2015 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Page, Arizona – This eye-catching lizard "patiently posed" for dozens of photos taken by Dana Barbato during a desert hike near Page, Arizona. Hide Caption 1 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Acadia National Park, Maine – Cadillac Mountain is the highest point on the East Coast of the U.S. The mountain is a popular tourist destination because of its sunrise views . Hide Caption 2 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Copenhagen, Denmark – The Nyhavn district was originally a busy commercial port in the 17th century . These days it's a popular waterfront district. Hide Caption 3 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Sossusvlei, Namibia – A warm sunset hanging over mountainous terrain in the Kulala Wilderness Reserve in Namibia captivated South African Lauren Haupt. "I loved the huge open spaces and the amazing scenic beauty. The dunes and sunsets. The desert meeting the sea." Hide Caption 4 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Bagan, Myanmar – The Buddhist temple of Shwezigon Paya is one of the best maintained temples near this ancient city. "After the trip past the stone stupas, when I entered the compound, I was awestruck by the majesty of the golden monument," said Robert Winter, who visited in 2014. Hide Caption 5 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day San Diego, California – Summer's winding down, so let's hang on to those memories with this sunny scene from Chris Morrow . Hide Caption 6 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Whitsunday Islands, Australia – Whitehaven Beach is only accessible by boat or plane. "Taking a seaplane rather than a boat gives you amazing panoramic views of the beach and the surrounding landscape," said traveler Victoria Peterson . Hide Caption 7 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Niagara Falls, Ontario – First-time visitor Muhammad Saiful Islam said the falls are beautiful all the time, "but particularly during dusk, when the falls are partially illuminated, and when there is partial daylight, the view becomes even more breathtaking." Hide Caption 8 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Lake Titicaca, Peru – On the floating islands of Peru's Lake Titicaca, descendants of an ancient people are gradually adapting to the modern times, says iReporter Sobhana Venkatesan , who visited in April. "Their traditions and skills, the ingenious way they have used reeds as a building material for their islands, houses and boats help us understand an ancient culture." Hide Caption Singapore – Visitors enjoy Wonder Full , Southeast Asia's largest light and water show . Hide Caption 10 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Greer, South Carolina – A spider web gathers water droplets on a summer morning. "I like how each droplet looks like a small world unto itself," said the photographer, Hank Borgsteede . "Life is full of beautiful things ... for those who pause to look." Hide Caption 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Grandfather Mountain, North Carolina – A hummingbird goes in for a snack. Hide Caption 12 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Nagoya, Japan – Known for its golden dolphins , or kinshachi, Nagoya Castle stood until parts of it burned down when the city was attacked during World War II. The castle was rebuilt and remains a popular destination for tourists. Hide Caption 13 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Gili Trawangan, Indonesia – "The starfish were literally everywhere on the beach hiding underneath the rocks and corrals that were exposed at low tide," says Joyce Wilmot , who captured this photo of her daughter. Hide Caption 14 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Istanbul, Turkey – "Turkey is a treat for all the senses," says Freddy Sherman. He took this colorful photo in an Istanbul spice market that smelled as amazing as it looked. Hide Caption 15 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Beirut, Lebanon – Fulvia Bonaiuti was walking through Beirut when she met an artist preparing for an exhibition. She says he was very friendly and proud that she wanted to photograph the display. Hide Caption 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Mumbai, India – The sun sets behind fishing boats resting on Aksa Beach. Hide Caption 17 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Beijing, China – Slovakian photographer Vladimir Hrubsa saw these three women exercising every morning in Beijing. He said it was refreshing to see so many active older people."They seem to be enjoying their old age, having fun meeting up, staying active, taking part in activities they might not have had the time for during their youth," Hrubsa said. Hide Caption 18 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Wadi Rum Desert, Jordan – Visiting Jordan was a last minute decision for Daniel Bartasavich , but he says seeing the Wadi Rum Desert was one of the highlights of his vacation. Hide Caption 19 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day London – Dusk settles over River Thames, which flows through southern England. "The clear skies were in stark contrast to the smog which had been hanging over London the previous week," said Jon Lovatt. Hide Caption 20 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Florence, Italy – Jeff O'Kelley stumbled on this picturesque moment while wandering the streets of Italy. "The vivid blues of the setting sun, all the lights ablaze along the embankment and the amazing mirror-like surface of the water combined for a pretty cool shot," he said. Hide Caption 21 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Sao Thome das Letras, Brazil – This city is the fourth highest in Brazil. "At an elevation of 4000 feet ... it feels almost close enough to touch the clouds overhead flying by," said Andy Bovos. Hide Caption 22 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Page, Arizona – Horseshoe Bend, a horseshoe-shaped meander of the Colorado River, is not technically part of the Grand Canyon, but tour groups consider it part of the canyon experience. Brian Clopp stumbled on this scene by accident, but considered it one of the greatest parts of his trip. Hide Caption 23 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Los Angeles, California – A rainbow is spotted on the drive between Las Vegas and Los Angeles. "The desert with its wide open spaces is really beautiful with endless skies," Marie Sager said. Hide Caption 24 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Ortahisar, Turkey – A hot air balloon ride over Turkey allows travelers to see a new side to the country. "Nowhere else on Earth can you experience the unique and beautiful blend of history and geology that makes this so definitively Turkey." Brian Thio said. Hide Caption 25 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Kep, Cambodia – Women haul crabs down the dock to a crab market about 100 feet away. "Until that moment they had been carrying the baskets individually one at a time," said Brian Clopp. "The image of unity and cooperation stood out as I watched this human chain form and walk together. They were having so much fun with it, and moving as one, it was a surreal sight to see." Hide Caption 26 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Dublin, Ireland – The Pomodoro "Sphere within Sphere", often called the Trinity Globe , has been on display at Trinity College since 1982. Sculptor Arnaldo Pomodoro's globes can be found all over the world. Hide Caption 27 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Cinque Terre, Italy – Cinque Terre is a string of beautifully colored fishing villages constructed on the Italian Riviera. "It turned out to be a really magical place," said Brian Beard. Hide Caption 28 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Hughesville, Maryland – Blue Jays are a welcome sight in Maryland, adding a pop of color in wooded areas. "Observing the birds out my kitchen window is a peaceful way to start the day," said Janie Lambert. Hide Caption 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Beijing, China – Delicate cherry blossoms stand out against the clear blue sky in Chaoyang Park . Hide Caption 30 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Woodstock, South Africa – Graffiti is an extremely popular form of expression in Cape Town's communities. "After the rain comes sun" is a creation by Faith47, one of the country's most famous street artists. Hide Caption 31 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Hvassahraun, Iceland – One night, when aurora activity was picking up, photographer Sigurdur William Brynjarsson drove into a lava field and found the Northern Lights dancing above him in a thin line. He couldn't get a good shot, so he layered 10 photos together to make this 180-degree panoramic image. Hide Caption 32 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Busan, South Korea – Geumjeong Mountain offers views of the South Korean port city of Busan from every angle. "It's awesome watching Busan up there," said Jeremy Jang . Hide Caption 33 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Katmai National Park and Preserve, Alaska – This active volcanic landscape is a vital habitat for salmon and the thousands of brown bears that rely on them for sustenance. Reddy Sarsam visited the park in July and witnessed the great feasting. "Life is strange, salmon swim so many miles from the sea to become prey for waiting bears," Sarsam said. Hide Caption 34 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Gleichen, Alberta – Lee Gunderson noticed horses munching on the grass in someone's front yard while on a walk. Gunderson said the owner told him he didn't care how the grass got cut, "'just that the horses do it for free and I can watch TV.'" Hide Caption 35 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day La Paz, Bolivia – Yungas Road, labeled one of the world's deadliest roads, allows bikers to travel on a thin, steep path that claims hundreds of lives each year. "I had heard about the death road since before I got there, but actually being on it and biking down through the mountains and into the jungle was an incredible experience," said Matthew Meshey. Hide Caption 36 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Lankanfushi Island, Maldives – Paradise beckons in the form of a hammock tethered to two pieces of drift wood. "I was taken aback by the clarity and color of the water. It looked as if it were plucked right out of a Photoshopped luxury travel magazine," said Holly Heft. Hide Caption Dhaka, Bangladesh – Boat races figure prominently in Bangladesh's culture, writes journalist Al Masud Nayon . Hide Caption 38 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Oahu, Hawaii – A turtle explores a shipwreck in Hawaiian waters. Peter Restivo captured this curious creature while scuba diving. Hide Caption 39 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Lucknow, India – Flowers bloom around Butler Palace , constructed in 1915. The palace has three buildings and a botanical garden for tourists to meander through. Hide Caption 40 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Dallas, Texas – "Right in the middle of all the commercial and residential concrete jungle, this sight provides a nice, refreshing view," says commuter Bipin Raut . Hide Caption 41 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Kep, Cambodia – A man reunites with his cattle during a breathtaking sunset. "This shot reminded me how beautiful the world is, and how people endure and embrace this beauty despite the region's broken past," said Brian Clopp. Hide Caption 42 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Naples, Italy – Empty sailboats drift serenely in Italy. "I love how the little blue sailboat has a different look than the others and is floating off on its own, doing its own thing," said Shabrea McElroy. Hide Caption 43 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Jounieh, Lebanon – The bay of Jounieh at night is well-known in the country for its nighttime lights. Hide Caption 44 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Santa Paula, California – To show his patriotism, Razmik Nazaryan crushed 108 cars to create this unique American Flag. It took him and his team over a year to complete the 75-foot-long creation. Hide Caption 45 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Oak Harbor, Washington – A boat passes under a bridge at the Deception Pass State Park strait during sunset. "The photo captures the peace and majesty of the whole area," said William Wyckoff. Hide Caption 46 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day San Diego, California – Surfers ride the calm waves in Pacific Beach , a neighborhood that rests between La Jolla and Mission Bay. Hide Caption 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Ngorongoro Conservation Area, Tanzania – Maasai tribesmen watch their cattle graze alongside wild zebras. Hide Caption 48 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day New York, New York – A full rainbow stretches over the city. This rare occurrence was captured by iReporter Jeffrey Berman . Hide Caption 49 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Tien Giang, Vietnam – A Buddha statue smiles happily at the Vinh Trang Pagoda in the Vietnamese city of My Tho. "I was very excited to enter a Vietnamese temple ... to learn about their way of worship," said Joyce Anthony . Hide Caption 50 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day St. John, U.S. Virgin Islands – A mongoose stares intensely at iReporter Hank Borgsteede. He saw this furry friend in a tree while walking along the island. "I've seen mongooses several times before, but this was the first time I'd seen one in a tree," he said. Hide Caption 51 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Mumbai, India – A coconut vendor prepares for customers on a warm spring afternoon. Bijoy Mishra travels frequently to India and enjoys taking photographs of the livelihood of the locals in Mumbai. Hide Caption 52 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Winslow, Arizona – Dan Navarro took this photo around sunset after a rain storm in the Little Painted Desert county park. This desert stretches from the Grand Canyon to the Petrified Forest National Park . "The shadows that were cast gave it a feeling of movement like a wave," said Navarro. Hide Caption 53 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Akranes, Iceland – The northern lights dance on Nordic skies. Finnur Andrésson took this image of the famous lights appearing over an abandoned farm in his hometown. "I am always amazed by their beauty when I see them," he said. "It's like another world." Hide Caption 54 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Mithi, Pakistan – The sun hangs over Mithi, the capital of the Tharparkar District in the Sindh province of Pakistan. Dominic Reigns captured this photo in 2012. "Pakistan is not what it is depicted through the lens of a camera. It has its own beautiful, culture, traditions and it gave me a sense of belongingness." Hide Caption 55 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Washington, D.C. – This serene photo was shot by iReporter Greg Griffith with the use of a prism to get the reflection of the sky in the water in front of the Lincoln Memorial. Tourists are frequently told that the 57 steps leading to the Lincoln Memorial reflect his age at death, but Lincoln was actually 56 years old when he was shot. Hide Caption 56 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Paris, France – Bonjour, Eiffel Tower! Travel blogger Freddy Sherman captured this grand view from his hotel balcony. Hide Caption 57 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Shanghai, China – William Lin captured this peaceful moment of the sun peeking through Shanghai smog. The air pollution is so heavy in China that 53% of American companies in China are having trouble filling executive positions. Hide Caption 58 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Niagara Falls, Ontario – People travel from all over the world to watch the Niagara Falls each dusk, including Lucie Blais , the photographer that captured this image. The falls are illuminated by 21 Xenon lights , each of which has 250,000,000 candlepower. Hide Caption 59 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Durango, Colorado – Cherie Morris caught an unusual sight when she noticed two horses chasing after a black bear on the ranch outside her home. Hide Caption 60 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Upper Peninsula, Michigan – A warm sky stretches across Lake Michigan , which lies on the southeast side of the peninsula. Hide Caption 61 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Milford Sound, New Zealand – Tucked away in Fiordland National Park , travelers can kayak through its cool waters and get another perspective of the South Island's mountains and forests. Hide Caption 62 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Sa Pa, Vietnam – This region in the Hoang Lien Son Mountains is a popular spot for trekkers to explore endless trails that overlook lush rice terraces . Hide Caption 63 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Honolulu, Hawaii – While scuba diving off the coast of Waikiki Beach, Peter Restivo came across a sunken ship. Hide Caption 64 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Breuil-Cervinia, Italy – This alpine resort in northwest Italy, popular for skiing in the winter, offers endlessly peaceful summer days . Hide Caption 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day San Francisco, California – Playful sea lions show off for crowds at Fisherman's Wharf. Hide Caption 66 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Berlin, Germany – Families fly kites at the former Tempelhof Airport. Once one of Europe's busiest, it ceased operations in 2008 and became a public park. Hide Caption 67 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Siam Reap, Cambodia – The Angkor complex , dating back to the 9th century, is an architectural feast for travelers. Hide Caption 68 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Charlotte Amalie, U.S. Virgin Islands – Amber and red grasses conjure a peaceful feeling at the Yacht Haven Grande marina in St. Thomas. Hide Caption 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Seward, Alaska – A peaceful marina sits in the foreground of Kenai Fjords National Park. Hide Caption 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Noonu Atoll, Maldives – Stunning views delight passengers coming to the island nation via seaplane. Hide Caption 71 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Yucca Valley, California – A roadrunner takes a break in Wanda Gemson 's yard. These birds don't do much flying, but they can run at speeds of up to 20 mph. Meep meep! Hide Caption 72 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Margraten, The Netherlands – Every Memorial Day , thousands of Dutch people come to pay their respects at the World War II Netherlands American Cemetery. Each grave has been adopted by a local family. Hide Caption 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Valea Babei, Romania – A local calms a pair of energized horses in the Maramures region. Hide Caption 74 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Philadelphia, New York – There's no highway sign directing tourists to this idyllic swimming hole in this upstate New York town, so you'll likely have it all to yourself. Hide Caption 75 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Ibiza, Spain – The island of Ibiza offers "more than just amazing parties," says Manuel Mayrhofer . Exhibit A: Beautiful nighttime views like this one. Hide Caption 76 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Ile Sainte-Marguerite, France – The landscapes of this island, half a mile from Cannes, fill one with "a magic sense of peace," says photographer Stefania Grasso . Hide Caption 77 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Borrego Springs, California – Seen from a drone: Sculptor Ricardo Breceda's enormous metal serpent emerges from the desert. Hide Caption 78 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Videy Island, Iceland – The Imagine Peace Tower is a poignant memorial to John Lennon, created by his widow, artist Yoko Ono. Hide Caption 79 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Oahu, Hawaii – Scuba divers enjoy a watery encounter with one of the sea's most stately creatures. Hide Caption 80 of 81 81 photos: Travel Photo of the Day Hallstatt, Austria – A train lets you off in the middle of a forest, where you then walk to a boat that takes you across a lake to this small village, says traveler Marie Sager . Hide Caption
